column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information and provide accurate labels for the comparisons.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information and provide accurate labels for the comparisons.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)

Note: Ensure that the labels accurately reflect the comparison and the presence of false information in the summaries. If there are discrepancies between the summaries and the reference text, carefully evaluate the accuracy of the information presented in each summary and assign the appropriate score based on the correctness of the information.
